etymology.description: Pictogram: a square well, with supports on four sides. Some forms have a stone inside the well, as in 丼.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a top-down view of a water well, with posts or supports at the corners creating a grid-like outline. Some historical variants show a stone or bucket inside, an element reflected in the derivative character 丼.

examples.chinese: 村里有一口老井(村裡有一口老井)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn lǐ yǒu yì kǒu lǎo jǐng.
examples.english: There is an old well in the village.

examples.chinese: 他从井里打水(他從井裡打水)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng jǐng lǐ dǎ shuǐ.
examples.english: He draws water from the well.

examples.chinese: 别往井里扔石头(別往井裡扔石頭)。
examples.pinyin: Bié wǎng jǐng lǐ rēng shí tou.
examples.english: Don't throw stones into the well.
